 It's an excellent point that we don't know the demographics of those surveys (one was done by Harris). I went to the ICPSR website that allows you to analyze survey data. I know that the General Social Survey attempts to be nationally representative. They asked over 900 people the following question in 2002:
 
 "Would you favor or oppose a law which would require a person 
 to obtain a police permit before he or she could buy a gun?"
 
 I was shocked to see that 80.5% said they were in favor of that. I think there is an impulse among many Americans to regulate gun ownership, but I think that most of the people willing to decide to vote one way or the other based on the control issue are pro-gun people.
